data.title: Barbara Loden, Actress, Writer, Director, and Wife of Kazan, Dies; Played Ill
data.text:
Barbara Loden, Actress, Writer, Director, and Wife of Kazan, Dies; Played Ill-Fated Wife 'Tough, Admirable Integrity'

Barbara Loden, Actress, Writer, Director, and Wife of Kazan, Dies; Played Ill-Fated Wife 'Tough, Admirable Integrity'

Sept. 6, 1980

See the article in its original context from

September 6, 1980 , Section M , Page 26Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

Full text is unavailable for this digitized archive article. Subscribers may view the full text of this article in its original form through TimesMachine.

Barbara Loden, one of the first women to write, direct and star in a feature film, died of cancer yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 48 years old and was married to the director Elia Kazan. View Full Article in Timesmachine Â»
